sections.text: Sale when installment not dueWhen the seizing creditor has a security interest, mortgage, lien, or privilege on the property seized, for a debt of which all the installments are not due, he may demand that the property be sold for the entire debt, on the same terms for the payment of unmatured installments as provided in the original contract.Acts 1989, No. 137, ยง18, eff. Sept. 1, 1989.
